00019 #ifndef SOCKETHANDLER_H
00020 #define SOCKETHANDLER_H
00021 
00022 #include <set>
00023 #include <string>
00024 #include <map>
00025 
00026 #include "util/Convert.h"
00027 #include "util/Err.h"
00028 #include "util/Util.h"
00029 
00030 #define SOCKET_PROTOCOL_VER 1
00031 
00032 /**
00033  * A listener class that will be called by SocketBase to parse and utilize
00034  * messages over a socket.
00035  */
00036 class SocketHandler {
00037 
00038 public:
00039   /// What type/format of message coming across
00040   enum MsgType {
00041     UNKNOWN_TYPE,
00042     TEXT,
00043     LAST_TYPE
00044   };
00045   
00046   /// What channel of message coming across (like stdout,stderr, etc.)
00047   enum MsgChannel {
00048     UNKNOWN_CHANNEL,
00049     VERBOSE,
00050     PROGRESS,
00051     KILLMSG,
00052     COMPLETION,
00053     LAST_CHANNEL
00054   };
00055 
00056   /** 
00057    * Determine if this handler should be called on messages from this channel
00058    * @param channel - What channel (e.g. SocketHandler::VERBOSE)
00059    * @return true if this handler is interested in messages from this channel
00060    */
00061   virtual bool handlesChannel(int channel) {
00062     return m_Channels.find(channel) != m_Channels.end();
00063   }
00064 
00065   /** 
00066    * Determine if this handler should be called on messages from this type
00067    * @param type - What type (e.g. SocketHandler::TEXT)
00068    * @return true if this handler is interested in messages from this type
00069    */
00070   virtual bool handlesType(int type) {
00071     return m_Types.find(type) != m_Types.end();
00072   }
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * Take a message and do whatever functionality this handler
00076    * implements from simply displaying message to 
00077    * 
00078    * @param type - What type (i.e. text, xml, ) of message is this message.
00079    * @param channel - What channel (i.e. verbose, progress, etc.) is this message.
00080    * @param msg - Data to be parsed out
00081    */
00082   virtual void handleMessage(int type, int channel, const std::string &msg) = 0;
00083 
00084   /**
00085    * Turn a map into a serialized string like "key1=val1,key2=val2," where 
00086    * value strings are escaped to protect the ',' characters.
00087    */
00088   static std::string serializeMap(std::map<std::string,std::string> &pairs);
00089 
00090   /** 
00091    * Turn a serialized map back into a full map by parsing out the key=val pairs
00092    */
00093   static std::map<std::string, std::string> deserializeMap(const std::string &s);
00094 
00095 protected:
00096 
00097   /**
00098    * Is there an even number of escape slashes preceeding position?
00099    */
00100   static bool evenPrecedingSlash(const std::string &s, int pos);
00101 
00102   /**
00103    * Is this character at position pos escaped?
00104    */
00105   static bool isEscaped(const std::string &s, char c, int pos);
00106 
00107   /**
00108    * Find the next occurance of c after start that is not escaped.
00109    */
00110   static int findNextNonEscape(const std::string &s, char c, int start);
00111 
00112   std::set<int> m_Channels; /// Collection of channels that a handler is interested in 
00113   std::set<int> m_Types; /// Collection of types that a handler is interested in
00114 
00115 };
00116 
00117 #endif /* SOCKETHANDLER_H */
